abstract_summ: CONCLUSIONS Our study overviewed and analyzed social media data on the dental services and oral health information during COVID-19 epidemic, thus providing insights for the government organization, media and dental professionals to better facilitate oral health communication and efficiently shape public concern through social media when routine dental services are unavailable during an unprecedented event.CONCLUSIONS: Topic modeling of news articles can produce useful information about the significance of mass media for early health communication.BACKGROUND: In case of a population-wide infectious disease outbreak, such as the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19), people’s online activities could significantly affect public concerns and health behaviors due to difficulty in accessing credible information from reliable sources, which in turn causes people to seek necessary information on the web.BACKGROUND Social media has become increasingly important as a source of information for the public and is widely utilized for health-related information.CONCLUSIONS: Our findings suggest that web search data may reflect changes in health literacy, social panic, and prevention and control policies in response to COVID-19.BACKGROUND: Since the beginning of the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak, fake news and misleading information have circulated worldwide, which can profoundly affect public health communication.
title_summ: SARS CoV-2 on the Polish InternetOnline Information Exchange and Anxiety Spread in the Early Stage of the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Outbreak in South Korea: Structural Topic Model and Network AnalysisHealth Communication Through News Media During the Early Stage of the COVID-19 Outbreak in China:Via Web Search Data During the COVID-19 Public Health Emergency:SARS CoV-2 on the Polish InternetPerception of emergent epidemic of COVID-2019 /Health Communication Through News Media During the Early Stage of the COVID-19 Outbreak in China:Nature and Diffusion of COVID-19-related Oral Health Information on Chinese Social Media:
